name: turbulence
content:
turbulence

noun
 
/ˈtɜːbjələns/
 
/ˈtɜːrbjələns/
 [uncountable]
jump to other results
  1. a situation in which there is a lot of sudden change, trouble, argument and sometimes violence synonym upheaval
    • a period of turbulence in the country’s history
    • The country is facing a summer of political turbulence.
    Topics Opinion and argumentc2
  2. a series of sudden and violent changes in the direction that air or water is moving in
    • We experienced severe turbulence during the flight.
